page.title: 12BUILDINGS IN ALTON
page.content: Probably the oldest building in Alton is St. Peter's Church,built in 1178 by the Normans and completely rebuilt in 1256.Alton Castle was first built by the Normans in 1158.The new castle, built by Pugin over the ruins of the Norman Castle is still in good repair and is now a boarding school.The chapel which adjoins the school has an intricately-made roof called the "Golden Roof".In the old castle a beautiful grotto has been made from the ruined walls. St. Johns Church adjoins a convent which was used as a hospital when it was built in 1840.St Johns School, attached to the convent,has two storeys,although most of the upper storey is used as a Guild Hall.The Church,the school and the convent were all designed by Pugin.
